page.title: 08TUNSTEAD QUARRY:KILNS
page.content: The Quarry has three types of Kiln: the{Rotary Kilns, the Calcimatic}and{ {Shaft Kilns.}The rotary kilns are tubes that revolve at a slow speed. The calcimatic kilns are disks which revolve at a slow speed. The kilns are powered by{North Sea {Gas}at the moment, but in the future {they are planning to return to using {coal,}which I.C.I. expect will be a cheaper fuel. The kilns convert limestone{ {(calcium carbonate) to lime,(calcium {oxide) or 'quicklime' as it is commonly called, by burning it up to a temperature of{1100 degrees {centigrade.} The kilns are {computer controlled from a room above.They are capable of producing{120-140 tons}of lime a day.
